events.name: Sold Out - The Art of Diorama
events.description:
Six Thursdays; January 25-March 1
7-9:30 pm

Museum exhibition specialist Tom Doncourt leads an after-hours look at our legendary dioramas. Discover how dioramas are made from start to finish, and hear behind- the-scenes stories about how they came together. In this six-part course for adults, you’ll travel the world through some of the Museum’s most popular exhibits and create your own replica to take home.

Note: All experience levels welcome. Enrollment limited to 25 people.

venue.name: American Museum of Natural History
venue.about: The American Museum of Natural History is one of the world's preeminent scientific and cultural institutions.

events.name: One Step Beyond with DJ set from Toro Y Moi
events.description:
Each month AMNH presents a different DJ performing in the Museum’s Rose Center for Earth and Space. Guests can also take a walk up the Cosmic Pathway to the Hayden Big Bang Theater where acclaimed actor Liam Neeson narrates a dynamic flight through the virtual universe based on an accurate cosmic atlas. 

Beer and wine will be served at a cash bar. Advance purchase of tickets is recommended to guarantee entry. This month's One Step Beyond will feature DJ sets from Toro Y Moi, Nathaniel Jay (Love Notes From Brooklyn), and Working Women.

venue.name: American Museum of Natural History
venue.about: The American Museum of Natural History is one of the world's preeminent scientific and cultural institutions.

events.name: Astronomy Live: NASA Missions
events.description: Every beautiful image we see of our solar neighborhood comes from NASA probes exploring local planets and their moons, along with data that is rarely seen. Join Emily Rice and Mark Popinchalk on a journey through the solar system, featuring information and images gathered through recent NASA missions.

venue.name: American Museum of Natural History
venue.about: The American Museum of Natural History is one of the world's preeminent scientific and cultural institutions.

events.name: Sold out - Dinos After Dark
events.description: Back by popular demand! Go back in time for a prehistoric party in the Museum’s celebrated dinosaur halls. Toast the Titanosaur and enjoy an exciting evening of expert talks, demonstrations, and after-hours access to the fossil halls. Wander freely, with cocktail in hand, and come face-to-face with the dinos after dark.

venue.name: American Museum of Natural History
venue.about: The American Museum of Natural History is one of the world's preeminent scientific and cultural institutions.

events.name: Meet the Scientist: How a Thought Becomes a Memory
events.description:
Important Information:
Space is limited and tickets are distributed at the Discovery Room on a first-come, first-served basis for sessions at 2:15, 3:00, and 3:45.

About the Event:
When you learn a new fact, sense things in your environment, or imagine something you’ve never thought of before, your brain creates new connections so that these experiences and ideas can be stored as memories. Rosemary studies the language that our brains and bodies use to communicate with each other in order to understand how these connections are formed and how they can change over our lifetimes as we continue to learn new things and have new experiences. Come learn about the brain’s incredible ability to make new memories throughout the course of a single lifetime.

*Meet the Scientist programs are for visitors 7 years old and older.*

venue.name: American Museum of Natural History
venue.about: The American Museum of Natural History is one of the world's preeminent scientific and cultural institutions.

events.name: Frontiers Lecture: Dangerous Worlds
events.description: Thousands of “exoplanets” have been discovered outside the solar system, and these new worlds are far more alien than we could have imagined. Join astrophysicist Elizabeth Tasker as she discusses the structures and features of exoplanets, and their potential for harboring life. A book signing follows.

venue.name: American Museum of Natural History
venue.about: The American Museum of Natural History is one of the world's preeminent scientific and cultural institutions.

events.name: Romance Under the Stars
events.description: Celebrate Valentine’s Day with a unique date night in the Hayden Planetarium! Join us for a cocktail hour in the Cullman Hall of the Universe, complete with open bar, hors d’oeuvres, and chocolates, accompanied by the music of the Josh Rutner Quartet. Then join Lydia Maria Petrosino and Ted Williams in the Hayden Planetarium for an unforgettable view of the night sky and some stellar romance stories from the ancient past.

venue.name: American Museum of Natural History
venue.about: The American Museum of Natural History is one of the world's preeminent scientific and cultural institutions.

events.name: Milstein Science Series: Ocean Technology
events.description:
Current underwater technology allows us to explore the ocean beyond our wildest imagination. Advanced devices such as submersibles, robotics, and sensors enable scientists to descend to depths unfit for divers, transmit data more quickly, and collect samples of unexplored ecosystems. Learn more about the explorers and equipment that make today’s investigations possible.

Free for Members or with Museum Admission.

events.description:
Celebrate winter: bundle up, embrace the chill, and join us for our annual Winter Carnival! Our popular Brewhouse, curling, and Silent Disco are back along with new additions like broomball, SkateFest, puppet shows for the kids, and more!  ❄️❄️❄️

All activities are free, admission to The Rink is free, skate rentals are $20, and food and beverage is available for a fee.

Browse all our Winter Carnival events at our website: http://bryantpark.org/programs/winter-carnival

Friday, January 26 – Sunday, February 4
Monday – Friday: 5:00pm-10:00pm
Saturday & Sunday: 12:00pm-10:00pm

events.name: Free Silent Disco at Bryant Park Winter Carnival
events.description:
Join us for our 4th Annual Winter Carnival Silent Disco, hosted by Southwest Airlines! This free outdoor dance party will have you shaking off the winter chill while onlookers wonder what the heck you’re doing…because the music can only be heard through headphones!

QuietEvents will provide the headphones and have 3 DJs spinning 3 different genres live: Top 40/EDM, 80s and 90s hits, and Motown/Oldies. Switch between channels as often as you like! Your headphones will glow to show everyone what you’re listening to.

The dance party (as well as headphone pick-up and drop-off) will be located on the Fountain Terrace, but there are no boundaries – feel free to roam the rest of Winter Carnival! Get a drink at the Southwest Porch or warm up in the Warming Lodge while grooving with your headphones. 

Fun giveaways courtesy of Southwest Airlines, while supplies last.

*No pre-registration or tickets required, however the number of headphones is limited so participation is while supplies last.

Event entry open from 6:00pm - 9:00pm. To check out headphones, you must swipe a credit card or debit card. If you fail to return your headphones by 9:15pm on 1/29/2017, your card will be charged $100. Bundle up and dress for the weather - we will be outside! No bag/coat check available.

Photo: Angelito Jusay Photography

events.name: Dissecting Clothing with Emily Spivack
events.description:
Join artist Emily Spivack for a clothing dissection workshop. We will physically disassemble archetypal garments into their component parts, or "innards," to better understand what they're made of and how they were constructed. Learn more at http://mo.ma/2D4Xbqf

Free with admission. This workshop is designed for adult participants but children are welcome if accompanied by an adult collaborator. Space is limited and available on a first-come, first-served basis. Sign-up begins half an hour prior to each workshop.

events.name: Un-walling Citizenship
events.description:
Join us for a half-day workshop focusing on the idea of the border zone as a site of artistic and political creativity. Participants will investigate the US-Mexico border as a geography of interdependence and coexistence, oriented less by jurisdictional and territorial terms and policies, and more around the shared practices, norms, interests, and aspirations that characterize everyday life in a border region.

In addition to a moderated discussion around this timely topic and a visit to MoMA's Architecture and Design study center to view relevant works in the collection, the workshop will involve developing diagrams and other visualizations to highlight zones of urban conflict as important laboratories for rethinking citizenship in more inclusive ways, reoriented as a cultural and practical concept. 

Led by Teddy Cruz, architect and Professor of Public Culture and Urbanism, Visual Arts Department, University of California, San Diego; and Fonna Forman, Founding Director, UCSD Center on Global Justice.

Tickets are $15 and can be purchased online, at the information desk, or at the Film desk in advance of the program.

events.name: World Championship Boxing:  Gennady Golovkin vs. Daniel Geale
events.description: World Championship Boxing returns to "The World's Most Famous Arena" on Saturday, July 26th as the sport's fastest rising superstar GENNADY "GGG" GOLOVKIN makes his Madison Square Garden Arena debut when he puts his WBA and IBO Middleweight World Titles on the line against two-time world Champion, and top-rated contender DANIEL "THE REAL DEAL" GEALE. With the highest knockout ratio (89%) among all active champions, in addition to his extraordinary growth in viewership on HBO, Golovkin, 29-0-0 (26KO's), has become a must-see attraction in the international sporting world. Previously holder of the ('IBF') International Boxing Federation Middleweight and WBA "Super" Middleweight Title, Geale brings a distinguished record of 30-2-0 (16KO's) into the world title challenge with Golovkin. Geale is currently ranked #3 by the World Boxing Association. Gennady Golovkin vs. Daniel Geale 29-0, 26 KOs 30-2, 16 KOs Karaganda, Kazakhstan Sydney, Australia

events.name: Sunday at The Met—The Story of the Caesars
events.description:
This event is free with Museum admission. 

Join curator Julia A. Siemon and classicist Mary Beard for a discussion of Roman emperors and their stories.

This event will be held at The Met Fifth Avenue in The Grace Rainey Rogers Auditorium. Assistive listening devices are available from the ushers.

Presented in conjunction with the exhibition "The Silver Caesars: A Renaissance Mystery."

events.name: Artists on Artworks: Mickalene Thomas on David Hockney
events.description:
Join acclaimed artist Mickalene Thomas as she shares her reflections on the work of David Hockney and insights on her own artistic practice with Ian Alteveer, Curator of Modern and Contemporary Art at The Met.

Presented in conjunction with the exhibition David Hockney. This event will be held at  The Met Fifth Avenue in The Grace Rainey Rogers Auditorium.

Assistive listening devices are available from the ushers. 

This event is part of #MetFridays: New York's Night Out and is free with Museum admission.

events.name: Sight and Sound: Shostakovich, Michelangelo, Artistic Conscience
events.description:
The Orchestra Now
Leon Botstein, conductor
Tyler Duncan, baritone

Shostakovich's Suite on Verses of Michelangelo and the artwork of Michelangelo and others.

To commemorate the 500th anniversary of Michelangelo's birth, Shostakovich set eleven poems by the Renaissance master to music. This symphonic song cycle illuminates the timeless struggle of artists across the ages—from Michelangelo to Beethoven and Shostakovich himself—in their quest to remain free. Presented in conjunction with the exhibition Michelangelo: Divine Draftsman and Designer, on view at The Met Fifth Avenue, November 13 2017–February 12, 2018.

Tickets to this event start at $30 ($75 for the series) and include same day Museum admission. Bring the Kids for $1.

This event will take place in The Grace Rainey Rogers Auditorium.

https://www.metmuseum.org/events/programs/met-live-arts/the-orchestra-now-18-2

This is the second of The Orchestra Now's three-part series at The Metropolitan Museum of Art. View the series: http://met.org/2zPqL5c

events.description:
The Met Family Benefit offers kids of all ages the opportunity to enjoy creative activities in select Museum galleries, as well as dinner, dancing, and entertainment. The theme of the 26th annual Family Benefit, "Playing Games Beyond the Frames," will utilize The Met's extraordinary collection to showcase how people from different cultures and time periods experience play—from sports, to board games, to technology.

For more information, or to purchase advance tickets, please call the Development Office at 212-570-3948 or email familybenefit@metmuseum.org.

events.name: Charles Lloyd and The Marvels
events.description:
The iconic Charles Lloyd—jazz saxophonist, flutist, composer, and arranger—celebrates his 80th birthday in 2018 riding high on a second wave of popularity and innovation. The 2015 National Endowment for the Arts Jazz Master's latest offerings, with his ace ensemble, The Marvels, include traditional hymns, antiwar protest songs, and reenvisioned originals. "Music that evokes an uncommon state of grace." (National Public Radio)

Tickets to this event include same day Museum admission.

Enjoy a pre-performance drink in the Grace Rainey Rogers Auditorium. Doors will open approximately one hour prior to the event and you may purchase a drink prior to the show.

Charles Lloyd, saxophone and flute
Bill Frisell, guitar
Greg Leisz, pedal steel guitar
Reuben Rogers, bass
Eric Harland,drums

Welcome to the happiest day party in New York City! The Festival of Colors celebrates the coming of spring, the joy of friendship, and equality for all. This Indian Festival happens ever year, not only in India but throughout the world. Join us on Saturday March 17th or Saturday March 31st. events.name: New York Meets Havana (Now Sold Out)
events.description:
Check out their website for updates & info here - http://www.mcny.org/Havana

Download our FREE App at the link below to have all of NYC's Events in your pocket, accessible to you at all times - https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.wNYCDailyEvents_4036559

Visit and Bookmark www.NYCDailyEvents.com and www.NYCConcertGuide.com to stay up to date on upcoming events, tickets, and info!

Synonymous with mojitos, sultry nightclubs, and classic cars, Cuba, the Caribbean’s largest island, is enjoying a new moment in the sun thanks to a relaxing of U.S. relations. Inspired by our upcoming exhibition, Rhythm & Power: Salsa in New York (opens June 13), discover how Cuba's love of music and dance has mixed and melded with Puerto-Rican and Afro-Caribbean rhythms to create a sizzling cultural fusion unique to New York City. 

Event Timeline: 
8 pm to 10 pm
Renowned DJ Christian Martir of Sociedad Records and DJ Nego will spin salsa and Latin disco and legendary Santiago de Cuba instructor Danys 'La Mora' Perez will give an all-levels dance lesson. Ruedame will perform a traditional rueda casino and Havana native Carlos Mateu will share Cuban social dances. 

10 pm to 11 pm
Los Hacheros, an NYC-based band that revives fiery folkloric styles punctuated by the Cuban clave, will perform live.

11 pm to 12 am
DJ Christian Martir and DJ Nego will end the night spinning salsa and Latin disco. 

Throughout the Night
Havana born visual artist Bernardo Navarro Tomas and Carlos Mateu will have pop-up art installations on view. The Museum's landmark New York at Its Core exhibition will also be open for late viewing and Havana-inspired food and drinks will be available for purchase.

This event is co-sponsored by El Museo del Barrio, Cumbe: Center for African and Diaspora Dance, and New York International Salsa Congress. 

This is the first event in our Metro Mashups series of Friday-night house parties that celebrate the cultures that shape New York's distinctive nightlife and feature live music, dancing, and food and drinks inspired by other global metropolises.

events.name: Dance Theatre of Harlem 2018 New York Season
events.description:
"WONDERFUL TO SEE”
—THE NEW YORK TIMES


Repertoire Program

Dance Theatre of Harlem’s 2018 season promises to be a thrilling evening of dance, featuring unique and inspiring works that reflect the company’s rich legacy and the diversity of 21st century ballet. Highlights include the New York premieres of acclaimed choreographer Darrell Grand Moultrie’s Harlem on My Mind,  George Balanchine’s beloved Valse-Fantaisie and Christopher Wheeldon’s sublime This Bitter Earth, plus the revival of the legendary choreographer Geoffrey Holder’s masterwork Dougla, featuring guest artists and live music.

Vision Gala Program

The Vision Gala on April 4—the 50th anniversary of the assassination of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.—reflects on the legacy of Dr. King and the impact of that tragic event. In February 1969, less than a year after King’s death, Arthur Mitchell and his mentor, Karel Shook, founded Dance Theatre of Harlem as a beacon of hope for the youth in the neighborhood where Mitchell grew up. In a few short years, his response to tragedy became a leading dance institution of unparalleled global acclaim. Join Dance Theatre of Harlem for an evening of ballet and special guests celebrating the life-affirming beauty and call to action that grew out of loss.

Programs subject to change

Vision Gala Program
Wed Apr 4 7pm
Brahms Variations (excerpt) – Robert Garland
Change – Dianne McIntyre
Pièce d’ Occasion – Robert Garland for the DTH School
Le Corsaire Pas de Deux – Marius Petipa
Dougla (Company Revival) – Geoffrey Holder

Vision Gala Dinner & Awards Ceremony immediately following the performance. 
Gala Dinner tickets must be purchased separately. Tickets can be purchased here: http://bit.ly/2B6eeWX  For more information contact The Benefit Office 212.889.4694.

Stay after the Friday night performance for Inside the Ballet – a conversation with Carmen de Lavallade on the creation of Geoffrey Holder’s magnificent masterwork, Dougla.

A produkció 2 x 60 perces, 20 perc szünettel a felénél. A showműsor nem korhatáros, de 6 éves kor felett ajánljuk.

A The Illusionists – Direct from Broadway producerei bejelentették legújabb európai turnéjukat a párhuzamos futó, rekordokat döntő new york-i, londoni és ázsiai szereplésük után. A 2016-os szezon statisztikája szerint a "The Illusionists" produkció érte el a legmagasabb bruttó bevételt egy hét alatt a Marquis and Neil Simon színházakban (Broadway), a Shaftesbury Színházban (West End), a Sydney Operaházban (Sydney, AUS), az Arts Centre Melbourne-ben (Melbourne, AUS) és az Auditorio Nacional-ban (Mexico City, MEX).

A The Illusionists – Direct from Broadway produkció a Szöveg Színház Színházi Egyesület közreműködésével kerül színpadra a Tüskecsarnokban 2018. május első hetében több alkalommal.

A The Illusionists – Direct from Broadway produkció a világ számos nagy színházában elért sikerek után most Budapestre érkezik, hogy rabul ejtse a magyar nézőközönséget. Észbontó látványvilág, káprázat és showműsor az, amelyet a világ hét hihetetlen illúzionistája a színpadra varázsol döbbenetes tehetségével. Tele vicces bűvésztrükkel, halált megvető attrakciókkal és lélegzetelállító mutatványokkal, a The Illusionists – Direct from Broadway elkápráztatja bármilyen korosztályú közönségét. A show-t különlegesen izgalmas és kifinomult varázslatba csomagolták, ahol a közönség észbontó mutatványok mint lebegés, elmében olvasás, eltűnés szemtanúja lesz. A világ jelenleg legkeresettebb mágusai elhozzák a múlt nagy illúzionistáinak – úgy mint Harry Houdini – előadóművészetét és párosítják azt egy újabb, korszerű kortárs esztétikával, aminek eszköztára -jelmeztervezése és színpadtechnikája- felejthetetlen és egyedülálló látványvilággal egészíti ki a produkciót, olyannal amilyet még soha nem láttunk. A Varázslat Cirque du Soleil-je, egy mókás este, ahol a showbiznisz találkozik a varázslattal ebben a fantasztikus műben. Végre Budapesten is megtekinthető lesz a világszerte már több millió embert elbűvölő attrakció.

Az előadások mindig szórakoztatóak, néha megdöbbentőek és biztosítanak minket afelől, hogy megfelelnek a rájuk aggatott címkéknek, mintha ez egyfajta szuperhős csapat lenne. Az Illúzionisták azt akarja tenni a varázslatért, amit a Cirque du Soleil tett a cirkuszért. És mivel nincs kitömve pszeudo-misztikus kacatokkal a jó részek között, egy következetesebb produkciót nyújt. Ez tiszta showbiznisz, tiszta showmankedés és hatalmas móka.

Felhívjuk a szülők figyelmét, vegyék figyelembe gyermekük testmagasságát a hely kiválasztásakor. Alacsony gyermek esetén javasoljuk az első sorokat, illetve a lelátókat.

A produkció 2 x 60 perces, 20 perc szünettel a felénél. A showműsor nem korhatáros, de 6 éves kor felett ajánljuk.

events.name: PopUp Dinner Brooklyn 2018
events.description:
#PopUpBrooklyn

PopUp Dinner Brooklyn

Saturday, June 2, 2018!

What is the PopUp Dinner Brooklyn? 
It is a beautiful picnic, a vibrant gathering and a dance party under the stars.
A celebration of LIFE, LOVE and COMMUNITY. 
It is what Brooklyn and each guest makes it. 
No other event brings together thousands of people to spontaneously celebrate creativity quite like this!

Secret Location! You buy your ticket and plan your picnic, but one question remains: where will the evening unfold? Guests know the event will take place in BROOKLYN but the exact location is revealed the day of. The goal is be able to celebrate everything Brooklyn has to offer from parks, waterfronts, and urban skylines. 

Dress Code! All white attire is the theme that pulls this summer evening gathering together but creativity is the only thing that's mandatory. We love to see hats, belts, accessories and more in the color of your choice. Be playful, be beautiful, be YOU!

Tabletop Décor! Your lovely tablescapes set the tone for a festive evening. This is outdoor dining in style. But your tables can be as simple or elaborate as you want. After setting up, guests wander the venue, wine glass in hand, to see what others have created and meet new people! 

The Food! We believe sharing a meal is an expression of love. Everyone becomes a foodie for the night and goes all out in creating, preparing and packing their delicious menu to be shared amongst thousands of new friends. 

The Wine! Since so much time and care went into creating the menu, it's certainly not an evening for ordinary vino and we want you to enjoy an event where you don't have to wait in line, or take out your wallet. Guests are encouraged to bring the wine/bubbles for their extravagant picnic.  *Please note: This event is 21 and older.

Entertainment! Music is the soul of any party and PopUp Brooklyn is no different. You have no idea which musical artist might take the stage on June 2nd and we are keeping the secret! But with past guests including Talib Kweli and Darryl McDaniels of Run-DMC, you can be sure the music will get people out of their chairs. 


* The PopUp is a 21+ event. IDs will be strictly checked at the door. We apologize for the inconvenience.

*Tables and chairs provided. Guests bring their own food and decor.

*Tickets are non-refundable but are transferable.

*Rain or shine we will dine!

Of course we’ll still have acrobats, stilt walkers, and jugglers, but that’s not all!  Stay tuned to see what else we have up our sleeves to make this a bigger affair than ever before!

events.name: Interference AV: Jlin, Lightning Bolt, The Sun Ra Arkestra
events.description:
Times Square Arts and Clocktower present :

INTERFERENCE AV

Experimental video collective UNDERVOLT & CO. teams up with Clocktower to produce live projections on an epic scale for this three-night festival takeover of America’s top-grossing multiplex, AMC Empire 25. The movie theater-turned-concert stage will feature nightly headliners Jlin, Lightning Bolt and The Sun Ra Arkestra. 

Dynamic live projections by UNDERVOLT & CO. artists Peter Burr and Sabrina Ratté, will include their original work and live remixing of video art by other collective members including Andrew Benson, Jacob Ciocci, Birch Cooper, Brenna Murphy, Yoshi Sodeoka, Jennifer Juniper Stratford, Ryoya Usuha, and more. The party overflows to the popcorn lobby, where Clocktower curates DJs and a zine fair.

LIVE CONCERT SCHEDULE:
(7pm doors, 8pm show).
Feb 19: Jlin
Feb 20: Lightning Bolt
Feb 21: The Sun Ra Arkestra directed by Marshall Allen

Follow @TSqArts and @Clocktower_NYC for opening-act announcements.

RSVP here: https://withfriends.co/clocktower 
All three nights are FREE.
RSVPs are essential but will not guarantee entrance. Admission will be first come, first served at the door. No seats will be held. 

:::::

ABOUT:

INTERFERENCE AV is Times Square Arts and Clocktower’s second event in the AMC Empire 25, following the one-night-only concert and zine fair "Primal Screams" in March of 2016. 

CLOCKTOWER is a non-profit art institution working in the visual arts, performance, music, and radio. Founded in 1972 in Lower Manhattan by MoMA PS1 Founder Alanna Heiss. Clocktower is the oldest alternative art project in New York, and its radio station, Clocktower Radio, was founded in 2003 as one of the first all-art online museum radio stations in the world.

www.clocktower.org 
@Clocktower_NYC

TIMES SQUARE ARTS, the public art program of the Times Square Alliance, collaborates with contemporary artists and cultural institutions to experiment and engage with one of the world's most iconic urban places. Through the Square's electronic billboards, public plazas, vacant areas and popular venues, and the Alliance's own online landscape, Times Square Arts invites leading contemporary creators to help the public see Times Square in new ways. 

http://arts.timessquarenyc.org/times-square-arts/projects/at-the-crossroads/interference-av/index.aspx
www.TimesSquareNYC.org/Arts 
@TSqArts.

UNDERVOLT & CO. is an internet-based collective involved in the circulation of time-based art across varied presentational formats. Founded in 2013, their work has been exhibited widely, often taking the form of installations, screenings, performances, workshops and ongoing online projects. 

www.undervolt.co/ 
@Undervolt_Co.

events.name: LIVE in the Living ROOM: URBAN Campfire w/ MATT RODIN & Friends
events.description:
Matt Rodin is a familiar name and face in the Broadway community. He has created and produced original content for Broadway.com, SoulCycle, Dear Evan Hansen, and currently hosts Broadway At W and the “Red Carpet Challenge” - where he interviews the stars of Broadway’s currently running shows.

A lover of the Broadway community and performer himself, Matt has conceived “URBAN CAMPFIRE”, a night of acoustic music and spoken word featuring himself as well as friends in the community. For artists, it’s a safe space for self expression and experimentation - for audiences, it’s an opportunity to share a collective experience with New York City’s thriving creative community.

A truly unique evening of storytelling housed within the chic Living Room of the W NY Times Square, you don’t wanna miss it!

**This is a 21+ Event**

*This event may be filmed for live streaming purposes. By attending you are consenting to possible appearances on media platforms.
